1.  The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the facility:
The Linde Gas LLC facility located in Wayland, Michigan complies with NFPA 58 requirements for LP-Gas storage and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency accidental release were to occur involving our propane storage/handling system, it is our policy to immediately notify the Leighton Township Fire Department, who would respond to the emergency.  In addition, every employee is required to attend monthly safety meetings on updated safety practices and procedures.  Each propane filler is trained by a certified trainer in filling procedures.

2.  A description of the facility and the regulated substances handled:
The Linde Gas - Wayland facility stores propane in one 18,000-gallon above ground storage tank (AST).  Propane is put into storage cylinders of various sizes before they are sold and shipped from the facility.   The propane storage/handling process consists of one 18,000-gallon propane AST, propane cylinder filling equipment, filled propane cylinders of various sizes, and associated piping, valves, and other miscellaneous equipment.  

3.  The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:
The Linde Gas - Wayland facility complies with USEPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable federal, state, and local codes and regulations.  The propane system has been designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA 58 and state law.  Employees are trained annually on the possible dangers and preventative measures to be taken in the event of an accidental release.  

4.  Five-year accident history:
The Linde Gas - Wayland facility has not had any reportable accidents involving its propane storage/handling process in the past five years.  

5.  The emergency response program:
In the event of an emergency accidental release involving our propane storage/handling system, it is Lin

de Gas' policy to immediately notify the Leighton Township Fire Department, who would respond to the emergency.  We have communicated this policy with the Leighton Township Fire Department.  All employees have access to Linde Gas' emergency action plan.  Emergency action training is conducted annually.  

6.  Planned changes to improve safety:  NONE
